title: Ticket #5400: Can't install HTCondor from RPM with glite components
description:
Systems with EMI/UMD Software use the ClassAds library in EPEL (build from our release in April, 2011). When installing RPMs using the new packaging, it identifies the classad library from EPEL as obsolete as the classad library in our distribution is more recent. The glite software is linked against libclassad.so.1 and we distribute libclassad.so.7. So, they should be able to coexist without issue. Having HTCondor 8.2.x installed alongside the EMI/UMD Software without issues supports this assertion.

For the UW RPMs, remove the Obsoletes clause for the ClassAd libraries.
remarks:
2015-Nov-17 16:49:55 by edquist:
code review for [46267]

Tim T explained why people wanted this (to keep an older classads library around because other applications use it), and that it should be possible to have the old classads installed alongside the newer condor-classads. Makes sense, and the packaging change is pretty straightforward.

As discussed with Tim T, The only thing we might want to do different is leave in the Obsoletes/Provides for classads-devel, as that will be an actual file conflict to install both the old and new headers. yum/rpm will (should) catch that and error out in that case at install time, but with Obsoletes/Provides for classads-devel it will Do The Right Thing and just remove the old classads-devel, so that new programs will get compiled against the new condor-classads.
